node_info.name: redis
node_info.description: Get, send and update data in Redis

generic.label: Why this Product Manager loves workflow automation with n8n

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Delete a key from Redis

options.action: Atomically increment a key by 1. Creates the key if it does not exist.

options.description: Returns generic information about the Redis instance
options.action: Return generic information about the Redis instance

options.action: Return all keys matching a pattern

options.action: Pop data from a redis list

properties.name: key
properties.description: Name of the key to delete from Redis

properties.name: propertyName
properties.description: Name of the property to write received data to. Supports dot-notation. Example: "data.person[0].name".

properties.name: key
properties.description: Name of the key to get from Redis

properties.name: keyType
properties.description: Requests the type before requesting the data (slower)

options.name: Automatic
options.description: Requests the type before requesting the data (slower)

options.name: Hash
options.description: Data in key is of type 'hash'

options.name: List
options.description: Data in key is of type 'lists'

options.name: Sets
options.description: Data in key is of type 'sets'

options.name: String
options.description: Data in key is of type 'string'

properties.name: options
properties.description:
By default, dot-notation is used in property names. This means that "a.b" will set the property "b" underneath "a" so { "a": { "b": value} }.

If that is not intended this can be deactivated, it will then set { "a.b": value } instead.

.

options.name: dotNotation
options.description:
By default, dot-notation is used in property names. This means that "a.b" will set the property "b" underneath "a" so { "a": { "b": value} }.

If that is not intended this can be deactivated, it will then set { "a.b": value } instead.

.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Name of the key to increment

properties.name: expire
properties.description: Whether to set a timeout on key

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: Number of seconds before key expiration

properties.name: keyPattern
properties.description: The key pattern for the keys to return

properties.name: getValues
properties.description: Whether to get the value of matching keys

properties.name: key
properties.description: Name of the key to set in Redis

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value to write in Redis

properties.name: keyType
properties.description: Tries to figure out the type automatically depending on the data

options.description: Tries to figure out the type automatically depending on the data

options.description: Data in key is of type 'hash'

properties.name: valueIsJSON
properties.description: Whether the value is JSON or key value pairs

properties.name: expire
properties.description: Whether to set a timeout on key

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: Number of seconds before key expiration

properties.name: channel
properties.description: Channel name

properties.name: messageData

properties.name: list
properties.description: Name of the list in Redis

properties.name: messageData
properties.description: Data to push

properties.name: tail
properties.description: Whether to push or pop data from the end of the list

properties.name: propertyName
properties.description: Optional name of the property to write received data to. Supports dot-notation. Example: "data.person[0].name".

properties.name: options
properties.description:
By default, dot-notation is used in property names. This means that "a.b" will set the property "b" underneath "a" so { "a": { "b": value} }.

If that is not intended this can be deactivated, it will then set { "a.b": value } instead.

.

options.name: dotNotation
options.description:
By default, dot-notation is used in property names. This means that "a.b" will set the property "b" underneath "a" so { "a": { "b": value} }.

If that is not intended this can be deactivated, it will then set { "a.b": value } instead.

subProperties.name: dotNotation
subProperties.description:
By default, dot-notation is used in property names. This means that "a.b" will set the property "b" underneath "a" so { "a": { "b": value} }.

If that is not intended this can be deactivated, it will then set { "a.b": value } instead.

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
